block.p: TRUISMS ON TRIAL -- All politics is local. Incumbents are invulnerable. Money talks. And Karl Rove is a political genius. This election is challenging many of the verities of American politics.
WEEK IN REVIEW
DONOR SHIFT -- Many big donors who gave to the New York's Republican governor, George E. Pataki, in past campaigns have given to the Democrat, Eliot Spitzer, this year.
PAGE 43
RACES TO WATCH -- A look at the closest races in the battle for control of Congress.
PAGE 32
WHO IS THE DEMOCRATIC GINGRICH? -- When Republicans won the House in 1994, much of the credit went to one man, Newt Gingrich. If the Democrats retake the House, it will be a different story.
WEEK IN REVIEW
IN NEW YORK -- A special counsel found a ''valid legal basis'' to seek to remove State Comptroller Alan G. Hevesi from office, but stopped short of recommending action.
PAGE 37
IN NEW JERSEY -- Robert Menendez and Thomas H. Kean Jr. try to squeeze every last hand, and every last ounce of voter patience.
PAGE 37
TRUISMS ON TRIAL -- All politics is local. Incumbents are invulnerable. Money talks. And Karl Rove is a political genius. This election is challenging many of the verities of American politics.
